title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a new report parameter of type 'DateTime' in the BIRT report designer, in the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'. The invalid value is accepted, and the following definition shows up in the report design: <parameters><scalarparameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters> Two problems are observed here: (1) The model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss; see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/]), which is locale independent to ensure portability.
EB: The report designer should reject an invalid date/time string entered as the default value for a 'DateTime' type report parameter.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
4. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date/time string.
5. Save the report design.
6. Open the report design and verify that the invalid value is accepted and stored incorrectly.

Expected behavior: The report designer should reject the invalid date/time string entered as the default value for the 'DateTime' type parameter.
